name: Michael Fonfara
description: '''Michael Fonfara''' (11 August 1946{{citation needed|date=January 2021}} â€“ 8 January 2021) was a Canadian keyboardist who was most notable for his work as a member of [[The Electric Flag]] and [[Rhinoceros (band)|Rhinoceros]] in the 1960s, [[Rough Trade (band)|Rough Trade]] and [[Lou Reed]]'s backing band in the 1970s and The [[Downchild Blues Band]], from 1990 to his death. He studied classical piano at [[The Royal Conservatory of Music]]. He is a multiple [[Maple Blues Award]] winner as Piano/Keyboardist of the year and a [[Juno Award]] winner with the Downchild Blues Band. His distinguished musical career was so honoured by the [[Maple Blues Awards]] as early as 2000 and a Juno Award in 2014.
